intro: Calobota angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calobota, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some ornamental species. The plant typically features slender, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale green. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or marshy environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
